title: Can bipolar disorder cause insanity? - Quora

response.answer_text: Insanity is an old fashioned way to refer to mental illness. As a person with bipolar, I can assure you that bipolar is a mental disorder. So, if you're bipolar you're insane. The word insane isn't used much any more. It's never used by psychological professionals. The problem is that it has tremendous baggage in terms of what people think about insane folks. I hope this clears things up. Jeff

Insanity is a laypersons term for psychosis or a severe break with reality predominantly with regard to logical thinking and its relationship to emotion. Tht being said, bipolar disorder in its acute state is a psychotic disorder and depending on whether its acute manifestation is depression or mania, it can be accompanied by delusional thinking paranoia grandiosity, etc. The good news is compliance with treatment and taking medication as prescribed usually keeps this disorder under control. The greater number of decompensationa is due to treatment noncompliances

Bipolar FEELS like insanity. Insanity is bipolar. Luckily there are medications that help control it (somewhat). Crawling out of the hellish nightmare to get help is Russian roulette depending on the shrink (or quack) you find. Then the game of what medications may or may not work for you, or over medicating, (I am on 12 different ones per day currently). It is a hell that never ends, so it is insanity.
